abstract: Combines elements from another publisher and deliver pairs of elements as tuples.

declaration.code:
func zip

(_ other: P) -> Publishers.Zip where P : Publisher, Self.Failure == P.Failure

overview:
## Return Value

A publisher that emits pairs of elements from the upstream publishers as tuples.

## Discussion

Use [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/zip(_:)] to combine the latest elements from two publishers and emit a tuple to the downstream. The returned publisher waits until both publishers have emitted an event, then delivers the oldest unconsumed event from each publisher together as a tuple to the subscriber.

Much like a zipper or zip fastener on a piece of clothing pulls together rows of teeth to link the two sides, [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/zip(_:)] combines streams from two different publishers by linking pairs of elements from each side.

In this example, `numbers` and `letters` are [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/PassthroughSubject]s that emit values; once [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/zip(_:)] receives one value from each, it publishes the pair as a tuple to the downstream subscriber. It then waits for the next pair of values.

If either upstream publisher finishes successfully or fails with an error, the zipped publisher does the same.
rawMarkdown:
--- source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/Combine/Publisher/zip(_:) crawled: 2025-12-05T01:13:11Z --- # zip(_:) **Instance Method** Combines elements from another publisher and deliver pairs of elements as tuples. ## Declaration ```swift func zip

(_ other: P) -> Publishers.Zip where P : Publisher, Self.Failure == P.Failure ``` ## Parameters - **other**: Another publisher. ## Return Value A publisher that emits pairs of elements from the upstream publishers as tuples. ## Discussion Use [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/zip(_:)] to combine the latest elements from two publishers and emit a tuple to the downstream. The returned publisher waits until both publishers have emitted an event, then delivers the oldest unconsumed event from each publisher together as a tuple to the subscriber. Much like a zipper or zip fastener on a piece of clothing pulls together rows of teeth to link the two sides, [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/zip(_:)] combines streams from two different publishers by linking pairs of elements from each side. In this example, `numbers` and `letters` are [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/PassthroughSubject]s that emit values; once [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/zip(_:)] receives one value from each, it publishes the pair as a tuple to the downstream subscriber. It then waits for the next pair of values. ```swift let numbersPub = PassthroughSubject() let lettersPub = PassthroughSubject() cancellable = numbersPub .zip(lettersPub) .sink { print("\($0)") } numbersPub.send(1) // numbersPub: 1 lettersPub: zip output: numbersPub.send(2) // numbersPub: 1,2 lettersPub: zip output: letters.send("A") // numbers: 1,2 letters:"A" zip output: numbers.send(3) // numbers: 1,2,3 letters: zip output: (1,"A") letters.send("B") // numbers: 1,2,3 letters: "B" zip output: (2,"B") // Prints: // (1, "A") // (2, "B") ``` If either upstream publisher finishes successfully or fails with an error, the zipped publisher does the same. ## Collecting and republishing the oldest unconsumed elements from multiple publishers - **zip(_:_:)**: Combines elements from another publisher and delivers a transformed output. - **zip(_:_:)**: Combines elements from two other publishers and delivers groups of elements as tuples. - **zip(_:_:_:)**: Combines elements from two other publishers and delivers a transformed output. - **zip(_:_:_:)**: Combines elements from three other publishers and delivers groups of elements as tuples. - **zip(_:_:_:_:)**: Combines elements from three other publishers and delivers a transformed output.
